title: A Spy Satellite You’ve Never Heard of Helped Win the Cold War
excerpt: Engineers at the Naval Research Lab launched a spy satellite program called Parcae and revolutionized signals intelligence at the height of the Cold War. The program relied on computers to sift through intelligence data, providing a technological edge at a pivotal moment in the Cold War.

title: The Scientist and the A.I.-Assisted, Remote-Control Killing Machine

title: Russia’s shadow tanker fleet runs into trouble
excerpt: Every day, millions of barrels of oil are being transported by ships with obscured ownership and origin. But is the game up?

title: In a Mutiny or Coup, the Scramble to Persuade and Pick a Side Is Critical
